main

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game class contains the main method which sets up the card game to be played. This is a text/terminal/console based card game. The card game is played with a deck of 56 cards, the 52 regular cards and 4 special 'penalty cards'. The user is prompted to enter the number of players (2-4) and the game begins. Each player picks one card from the shuffled deck each round. The player with the highest value card wins the round and is awarded 2 points. If two or more players draw the same highest value card, then rank is determined by suit as follows (greatest to least): Spades, Hearts, Diamonds, Clubs. If any player draws a 'penalty card' he is assigned -1 points for that round. The game continues until a player reaches 21 points or over and the closest second place player is more than 1 point away.
    Author:
    Micah T. Moore

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • startGame

        public static void startGame(int players)
        Starts the game after the number of players is determined. Creates the player list, score board, and deck. Each round is started by shuffling the deck. Each player is prompted to push enter to draw a card, any penalty cards are found and the cards are compared to find the winner of the round. If only penalty cards are drawn that round, there is no winner of the round. The cards are displayed on the screen as they are drawn. At the end of each round the winner of the round and what card he won with are displayed. The score board is also displayed with each players total current score.
        Parameters:
        players - number of players for the game.

      • isInteger

        private static boolean isInteger(java.lang.String s)
        Check whether a given string is an integer.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True if the string is integer. False otherwise.

      • isInRange

        private static boolean isInRange(int n)
        Checks if a given integer is within the range 2-4 inclusive.
        Parameters:
        n - integer to check whether it's in the range.
        Returns:
        True if n is between 2 and 4 inclusive. False otherwise.

      • playOn

        private static boolean playOn()
        Checks whether the user wants to play again by asking them with a prompt. The user's response isn't case sensitive so they can enter any variation of y,yes,n,n and it would be accepted as an input. If he enters anything else he is prompted to answer again.
        Returns:
        True if the user answered Yes, False if the user answered No.

      • wrapBigString

        private static java.lang.String wrapBigString(java.lang.String str,
                                              int lineLength)
        Takes a long string and returns it broken up in lines no longer than a given line length.
        Parameters:
        str - Long string to be wrapped.
        lineLength - Width of each line desired.
        Returns:
        String with new line characters added before each word that would make the line longer than lineLength characters.
